intro: Myosotis sicula, commonly known as the Sicilian forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the top of the stems. Myosotis sicula is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance.
